unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Annual Income Interval: What Does the Data Show?
question_text: One hundred randomly chosen adult subjects in Jacksonville, FL, were asked their annual income. The data reported from the sample showed a mean of $\$46{,}203$ with a standard deviation of $\$10{,}201$ . A $95\%$ confidence interval would show, approximately, that

choices.text: We are 95 % 95 % confident the average annual income for United States residents is between $ 44,179 $ 44,179 and $ 48,227 $ 48,227 .
We are 95 % 95 % confident the average annual income for Jacksonville, FL, adult residents is between $ 44,204 $ 44,204 and $ 48,202 $ 48,202 .
We are 95 % 95 % confident the average annual income for Jacksonville, FL, adult residents is between $ 25,801 $ 25,801 and $ 66,605 $ 66,605 .
We are 95 % 95 % confident the average annual income for Jacksonville, FL, adult residents is between $ 44,179 $ 44,179 and $ 48,227 $ 48,227 .
Assumptions are not met in this situation to compute an appropriate 95 % 95 % confidence interval.
